channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped car, 19th August
item.description:
Yet again another dumped car with the number plates removed there is a real Issue on sunfields place Lizban street with the local garages using these streets as there parking lot to Dump There cars removing number plates is a massive red flag as then no mot or tax can be checked these rds desperately need cpz implemented to stop This from Happening

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Lizban Street, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Remains of what appears to be a fox on the riverside near the slipway., 19th August
item.description:
If you go to the Thames slipway where the yacht club gate is, as you face the river, the remains are off the left side of the slipway - approx 15-20 from the slipway and approx 8-12 metres from the bushes. It's quite difficult to see until you get close up as it blends in with the stones etc.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Peartree Way, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Panel on lamp open exposing internal wiring, 19th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Aylesbury Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: All along parkmead by Shorne Close and also 99 -100, 19th August
item.description:
Along Park Mead there are several squares of concrete in bedded into the road. The one by Shorne Close is beginning to sink on one edge and the one by 99- 100 Park Mead is raised. Also by Cobham Close on Park Mead there is a large crack in the road. Please can these issues be looked into with a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Mead, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole road not been swept at all after reporting Leto weeks ago, 19th August
